9.m: Jesus said to them, 'I am the bread of life; whoever comes to me shall not hunger, and whoever believes in me shall never thirst.' - John 6:35 (ESV)

l.q: In what way is Christ the fulfillment of the Law and the Prophets?
l.a: The Word was in the beginning with God. The Word was God. All things were made through him. He has life, which is the light of men. He is coming into the world.

l.q: In Galatians 5, since Christ has already set us free from the bondage of sin, how then should we live our lives?
l.a: We should not submit again to a yoke of slavery.

l.q: In Galatians 5, what are the fruits of the Spirit?
l.a: Jesus Christ came into his own, but the people did not receive him. But to all who did receive Jesus Christ and believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God.
